title: 5-star WR Jamier Brown transferring Ohio high schools for senior year
description: Jamier Brown is a 5-star wide receiver recruit who is committed to Ohio State. He is transferring high schools in Ohio for his senior season.
fullText:
Five‚Äëstar wide receiver Jamier Brown, one of the nation‚Äôs top prospects in the Class of 2027, is transferring from Wayne High School to Big Walnut ahead of the 2026‚Äì27 school year, according to the Dayton Daily News.

Brown, an Ohio State commit, is rated the No. 11 overall recruit nationally, the No. 2 wide receiver in his class and the No. 1 player in the state of Ohio, according to 247 Sports.

The move was first reported by On3‚Äôs Andy Villamarzo, who noted that Brown will join a Big Walnut program that has reached the Division II state semifinals in each of the past two seasons. Brown caught 73 passes for 1,009 yards and 10 touchdowns in 2025, finishing second in the Greater Western Ohio Conference, and also excelled on special teams with multiple return touchdowns.

Brown was previously at the center of a landmark NIL lawsuit involving the Ohio High School Athletic Association, which ultimately led to NIL approval for high school athletes in Ohio. He is expected to finalize the transfer before summer workouts begin.

This article originally appeared on USA TODAY High School Sports Wire: Jamier Brown, a 5-star Ohio St. recruit, is transferring high schools

title: 3 stars for the 49ers from the Divisional round: Brock Purdy went down swinging
description: Plus, some love for Dee Winters and Eddy Pineiro
fullText:
The San Francisco 49ers‚Äô season ended in a massive crash and burn at the hands of a SCORE rout by the Seattle Seahawks.

Rashid Shaheed took the opening kickoff 95 yards for a touchdown, and the next 59 minutes and 47 seconds of game time felt like torture. By the time the 49ers took the field for their third possession, they were already facing a 17-point deficit, and it would only get uglier from there.

For the final time, let‚Äôs look at the three stars from Saturday‚Äôs season-ending loss:

For the second time in three weeks, Pineiro was responsible for 100 percent of the 49ers‚Äô points against Seattle. After his season with the 49ers began after the 49ers‚Äô Week 1 victory in Seattle, Pineiro proved to be the 49ers‚Äô only offense in their next two games against the Seahawks.

Pineiro opened the scoring for the 49ers with a 40-yard field goal to start the second quarter. He quickly followed with a 56-yard make on the next drive to cut the Seattle lead to 11. Unfortunately for the 49ers and Pineiro, the 49ers kicker needed 12 more field goals on the night to put San Francisco in the lead.

After several years of kicking woes, Pineiro solidified the position for the 49ers, making 31-of-32 kicks on the season.

There wasn‚Äôt much to brag about for the 49ers‚Äô defense on Saturday night, but No. 53 was far and away the unit‚Äôs best player.

Winters finished with a team-high nine tackles, but his most significant impact came around and behind the line of scrimmage.

With Seattle already up seven in the first quarter, they moved the ball into field goal range, looking to double their lead on their first offensive possession. Facing a third-and-2, Seattle attempted a run with Zach Charbonnet to extend the drive, but Winters had other plans. The linebacker exploded through the line, barely giving the Seattle running back time to react after getting the ball, blowing up the play for a loss of two, and forcing the Seahawks to settle for three points.

Winters‚Äô next big play wasn‚Äôt a tackle for loss, but a big hit was involved. Coming out of the two-minute warning, Darnold looked for an easy completion to fullback Robbie Ouzts in the flats. While the ball got to Ouzts, Winters read the play well and made a beeline to the fullback, blowing him up, knocking the ball free, and forcing an incomplete pass.

Winters would add his next two tackles for loss on run attempts by Shaheed and Walker, but both came when the game was well out of reach. On such an embarrassing night for the defense, Winters was the only standout on the night.

Purdy‚Äôs performance wasn‚Äôt perfect, but it was nothing short of heroic.

Yes, there was the interception, but that felt more of a Luke Farrell effort issue than it was a Purdy issue, and the fumble lost came when the game was a lost cause.

But Seattle‚Äôs secondary was allowing no space and making everything tough on the quarterback, and he still didn‚Äôt have too bad of a game. Purdy was pulled at the start of the fourth quarter with a line of 15-for-27 for 140 yards with no touchdowns and one interception.

It‚Äôs tough to find any stretch where the 49ers‚Äô offense looked exceptionally great. Still, they managed back-to-back field goal scoring drives where Purdy led the offense, completing nine-of-12 passes for 81 yards, with consecutive completions to Jake Tonges going for 15 yards each.

Purdy also got the job done with his legs, leading all 49ers rushers with 37 yards on five attempts. While the 49ers‚Äô longest play of the game was a 19-yard completion to Jauan Jennings, right before the half, Purdy scrambled for a gain of 18, good for the 49ers‚Äô longest run of the game.

Other than that, it was a quiet night for Purdy, but that‚Äôs more of a credit to Seattle‚Äôs defense kicking the 49ers‚Äô ass for 60 minutes. But despite it all, it was a gritty performance from the 49ers quarterback, and on a night where not much was going right, that‚Äôs enough to earn the final first star of the season.

Throughout the season, I will track the three stars of the season, tallying points for each star award using a complex scoring system: three points for being the first star, two for the second, and one for the third. At season‚Äôs end, the standings are:

RB Christian McCaffrey ‚Äì 20 points

title: Eagles News: Philadelphia has 2 of the top 31 ranked free agents
description: Philadelphia Eagles news and links for 1/18/26.
fullText:
Of the rumored offensive coordinator candidates, who do you want the Eagles to definitely NOT hire? Head over to The Feed and weigh in with your answer and explanation!

Let‚Äôs get to the Philadelphia Eagles news and links ‚Ä¶

Ranking the Top 40 NFL Free Agents of 2026 ‚Äì The Ringer
3) Jaelan Phillips. The Eagles got away with highway robbery by acquiring Phillips from the Dolphins for a third-round pick at the trade deadline in November. His first two games in Philly came against two of the league‚Äôs better offensive tackles, the Packers‚Äô Zach Tom and the Lions‚Äô Penei Sewell, and Phillips still made his presence felt right away, with 12 pressures and a sack in his first two games. He has an ideal frame, great strength, and terrifying explosiveness, making him a dream fit as a stand-up rusher who can line up anywhere in Vic Fangio‚Äôs defense. Phillips can blow through and by tackles, and he often manhandles tight ends into the backfield when given the opportunity. He‚Äôs tied for fourth in total pressures (41) since joining the Eagles in Week 10. [‚Ä¶] 31) Nakobe Dean. Injuries have hindered Dean‚Äôs development since before he was drafted. He fell to the third round because of a pectoral strain. He only played 47 snaps as a rookie, and then missed a lot of the 2023 season with a Lisfranc injury. He finally started 15 games for Philadelphia in 2024, but he didn‚Äôt play beyond the wild-card round in the playoffs because of a torn patellar tendon that caused him to begin the 2025 season on the sidelines. He eventually returned to the starting lineup over the second half of this season, but he missed the Eagles‚Äô Week 17 matchup against the Bills with a hamstring injury. Health is the biggest, and perhaps only, question with Dean as he heads to free agency. He‚Äôs a tenacious run defender with great explosiveness and sideline-to-sideline range. He‚Äôs a difference-maker on three downs with his ability to play the run and rush the passer. He leads all linebackers with at least 30 pass-rush snaps in PFF‚Äôs pass-rush win rate (28.6 percent). Dean isn‚Äôt a complete liability in coverage, either, which is more than you can say about most starting linebackers in the NFL right now. It‚Äôs hard to project what Dean will command on the open market given just how much of his career has been impacted by injuries. When healthy, he‚Äôs as valuable as players like Jamien Sherwood and Nick Bolton‚Äîboth of whom signed three-year, $45 million deals last offseason. But will Dean have to sign for less purely because of the injury concerns? Probably.

An initial look at the Eagles‚Äô 2026 free agents ‚Äì PhillyVoice
EDGE Jaelan Phillips: The acquisition of Phillips was the Eagles‚Äô big trade deadline move this season, and for a change it worked out, as Phillips played well, as a pass rusher and against the run. Phillips seemed to be Vic Fangio‚Äôs top edge defender, as he consistently out-snapped Nolan Smith and Jalyx Hunt. That could be an indication that the Eagles make re-signing Phillips a priority.

Eagles, Brian Daboll will reportedly meet for offensive coordinator interview ‚Äì BGN
The Philadelphia Eagles are expected to interview former New York Giants head coach Brian Daboll for their vacant offensive coordinator position, according to a report from NFL insider Adam Schefter. It was previously reported that Daboll and Mike McDaniel are the two names ‚Äúat the top of [the Eagles‚Äô offensive coordinator candidate] list.‚Äù Daboll, 50, shares connections to both Nick Sirianni and Jalen Hurts after overlapping with them at different stages of his career.

Eagles reportedly request to interview Colts OC Jim Bob Cooter for same coaching role ‚Äì Stampede Blue
While at face, this is a lateral move, and it will be interesting to see if Indianapolis grants permission. It could at least be somewhat of a promotion, as Steichen consistently handles the offensive play-calling for the Colts. If that job would go to Cooter in Philadelphia, then it theoretically would be an elevation in offensive coaching duties. With Cooter‚Äôs coaching assistance last season, the Colts ranked 8th in most points per game (27.4 avg. ppg), and that was despite losing starting quarterback (and Pro Bowl alternate) Daniel Jones for the last four starts of the regular season due to a season-ending torn Achilles injury. Until Jones‚Äôs fractured fibula and then torn Achilles after midseason, the Colts were a historically elite NFL offense. Even with the unit‚Äôs diminished production down the final stretch, star workhorse Jonathan Taylor still rushed for 1,585 total rushing yards and 18 total rushing touchdowns (*leading the league) on 323 total carries.

Roob‚Äôs Observations: Has an Eagle ever had a worse playoff game than A.J. Brown? ‚Äì NBCSP
I keep hearing people say Tyler Steen wasn‚Äôt any good this year and bring back Mekhi Becton if the Chargers release him, blah, blah, blah. Where is this coming from? Guess what. Steen was fine this year and I don‚Äôt know why people are so down on him. He had a better year than Becton, and he was certainly better than Landon Dickerson and Cam Jurgens. Out of 66 guards who played at least 500 snaps, Steen‚Äôs Pro Football Focus grade of 73.4 ranked 14th, which isn‚Äôt bad at all. He was the Eagles‚Äô 2nd-most consistent offensive line starter, behind Jordan Mailata. Maybe the Eagles can do better and I don‚Äôt think anybody would be surprised if they drafted a guard-tackle pretty early in April to begin preparing for life after Lane. But you could do a lot worse than Steen did this year.

Eagles defensive line coach Clint Hurtt named a head coach at 2026 Senior Bowl ‚Äì Inquirer
As the NFL draft process gets underway over the next few weeks with the All-Star games circuit, one of the Eagles‚Äô position coaches will get a unique opportunity to be a head coach for a week. Defensive line coach Clint Hurtt will lead the National team at the Reese‚Äôs Senior Bowl, which begins practice in Mobile, Ala., on Jan. 27. The event brings in the top draft-eligible players to compete in three practices, culminating in the Senior Bowl game on Jan. 31 at 2:30 p.m. at the University of South Alabama‚Äôs Hancock Whitney Staduim.

Former Cowboys pass rusher DeMarcus Lawrence headed to NFC Championship Game with Seahawks ‚Äì Blogging The Boys
DeMarcus Lawrence will get to play in an NFC Championship Game. In his first season away from the Cowboys, Lawrence will officially reach the territory that has eluded the Cowboys since well before the team traded up to draft him in the second-round of the 2014 NFL Draft. This marks the second year in a row where a former Cowboys player made it to the title game in their first season away from the team, by the way. Last year it was Tyler Biadasz, Dorance Armstrong, Noah Igbinoghene, and Dante Fowler (who later returned obviously) who were a part of the Washington team that reached the step before the Super Bowl. Where DeMarcus is a bit different than them is he had some choice words to say about the Cowboys as he left that were related to this whole thing. You will recall that upon arriving in Seattle that Lawrence did an interview where he called Dallas his home, but he said that he would never win a Super Bowl there. Micah Parsons, then a member of the Cowboys, got defensive and the two had a back and forth on X/Twitter, but ultimately history is written by the winners and right now DeMarcus is the one holding the pen.

Everything there is to know (currently) about the Commanders new stadium at the RFK stadium campus is available in one place ‚Äì Hogs Haven
A 35-page document that has been submitted to the National Capital Planning Commission for review. The full document is available for review by clicking HERE. The document does not answer every question about the stadium ‚Äî it primarily addresses how the stadium fits into the surrounding area and complies with legal requirements. You won‚Äôt find seating area design, discussion of the food service or what type of field surface is planned.

NY Giants news: Cleveland Browns might wreck plan to hire Todd Monken as OC ‚Äì Big Blue View
New York Giants coach John Harbaugh (it is still nice to write that) is expected to want to bring Todd Monken, his offensive coordinator the last three seasons with the Baltimore Ravens, to the Giants to work with quarterback Jaxson Dart. The Cleveland Browns, though, appear to be an obstacle. Monken will interview in-person on Tuesday for the Browns vacant head-coaching job, according to ESPN NFL insider Jeremy Fowler. Monken has already has a virtual interview with the Browns, who fired Kevin Stefanski at the end of the season.

NFL coaching hire grades for every team involved in 2026 cycle ‚Äì SB Nation
New York Giants: John Harbaugh. When the initial job vacancies were listed, the Giants‚Äô job was one of our favorites on the open market. Only when the Ravens parted ways with Harbaugh was New York pushed down the list. And when the Ravens parted ways with Harbaugh, it made him one of the more attractive candidates on the open market. To us, this looks like a perfect pairing. More than anything else, the Giants need stability at the head coaching position. Since Tom Coughlin‚Äôs last season, the 2015 campaign, New York has cycled through four different head coaching options. Harbaugh will be the fifth. Giants fans are not hoping to see a sixth anytime soon. Grade: A.

Kevin Stefanski hired by Atlanta Falcons as new head coach ‚Äì The Falcoholic
After a search that saw the Falcons interview or request interviews with close to a dozen candidates, the team has hired Kevin Stefanski, making the former Browns head man and Vikings offensive coordinator the 14th full-time head coach in franchise history. Matt Ryan‚Äôs first and arguably most consequential hire as president of football for the Falcons sees him land on the most experienced non-Mike McCarthy candidate on the market with a strong offensive background, a bet on a coach who piloted the Browns to the playoffs in 2023 with one of the least inspiring quarterback rooms in recent memory.

title: üî• Malen makes a dream debut for Roma: starts and scores
description: Donyell Malen's impact in Serie A could not have been more immediate. Just two days after his move from Aston Villa to the Italian capital became official, the Dutch striker took to the pitch at the S...
fullText:
Donyell Malen's impact in Serie A could not have been more immediate. Just two days after his move from Aston Villa to the Italian capital became official, the Dutch striker took to the pitch at the Stadio Olimpico di Torino to face Torino and wasted no time in showing why the "giallorossi" management bet on him in this winter transfer window. In a display of instinct and speed, Malen needed only 25 minutes to score his first goal wearing the wolf's shirt, unleashing euphoria among the traveling fans.

The goal came after a high-precision team move that highlighted the immediate chemistry among the key pieces of Roma's attack. Following a blistering counterattack led by Paulo Dybala, the Argentine star threaded a pinpoint pass into the heart of the six-yard box. Malen, showcasing his excellent reading of the game, got ahead of the Torino defense and struck a crisp right-footed shot that beat the opposing goalkeeper through the center of the goal, making it a provisional 0-1 on the scoreboard.

Although VAR added a dose of suspense by reviewing a possible offside in a previous play, the final validation of the goal confirmed that the Dutchman's debut was destined for success. Wearing the number 14 on his back, the former Borussia Dortmund player was very active throughout the first half, not only seeking the goal but also constantly offering support and making runs that unsettled the home defense. His ability to adapt to Roma's playing system seems to have exceeded all initial expectations.

This goal-scoring debut is a breath of fresh air for Malen's career, as he was looking for a change of scenery after a year of ups and downs in the Premier League. His arrival in Italy on loan with an option to buy ‚Äî which could reach 25 million euros ‚Äî seems to be the ideal setting to relaunch his progression. Roma, fighting for Champions League spots, have found in him that versatile finisher who can play both as a reference point and drifting wide, bringing the offensive aggression needed for the second half of the season.

At the end of the match, the feelings could not have been more positive for the club's environment and for the player himself. Scoring in the first game eliminates any initial pressure and builds the confidence of a player who is expected to be fundamental in the team's plans. If this debut is any indication of what's to come, Roma fans can look forward to a Malen-Dybala partnership that promises to bring plenty of joy to Calcio.

This article was translated into English by Artificial Intelligence. You can read the original version in üá™üá∏ here.

title: Former Giants HC Brian Daboll adds Eagles' OC job to list of interviews
description: Former Giants head coach Brian Daboll is becoming a popular name on the coaching market and could end up back in the NFC East.
fullText:
Former Giants head coach Brian Daboll is becoming a popular name on the coaching market and could end up back in the NFC East.

Daboll is expected to interview for the Philadelphia Eagles' offensive coordinator job, according to ESPN's Adam Schefter.

It'll be one of the many interviews Daboll has had this offseason, including a shot at the Tennessee Titans' head coaching vacancy and Los Angeles Chargers' OC job. Schefter noted that Daboll is expected to have other interviews this hiring cycle as well, likely for OC positions.

In Philadelphia, head coach Nick Sirianni demoted OC Kevin Patullo after the team's wild-card round loss to the San Francisco 49ers last week. The team is now looking for its fifth OC in six years. It's possible Patullo remains with the Eagles in a different role, as he served as the passing game coordinator prior to his promotion to OC for the 2025 season.

The Eagles' interest in Daboll goes beyond his familiarity with the former division rival. He worked with Sirianni in Kansas City in 2012 when he was the Chiefs' offensive coordinator under Romeo Crennel and Sirianni was the WR coach.

Daboll was also the OC and quarterbacks coach at Alabama in 2017 when they won the National Championship with Eagles QB Jalen Hurts as the starter and Miami Dolphins' Tua Tagovailoa as the backup. Philadelphia WR DeVonta Smith was also a freshman at Alabama that year and caught the game-winning pass in the title game from Tagovailoa after Hurts was benched.

And of course, Daboll coached RB Saquon Barkley during their time in New York together. Overall, Daboll went 20-40-1 as head coach of the Giants. He was named the 2022 NFL Coach of the Year after leading Big Blue to a 9-7 record and its only playoff win since 2011.

title: Patriots AFC East Rival Predicted To Trade For A.J. Brown
description: The Buffalo Bills‚Äô season ended on Saturday after a 33-30 loss to the Denver Broncos in the Divisional Round. Meanwhile, the New England Patriots will play their Divisional Round game on Sunday. The Bills have one of the best quarterbacks in the NFL, but have not been able to get over the hump with Josh [‚Ä¶]
fullText:
The Buffalo Bills‚Äô season ended on Saturday after a 33-30 loss to the Denver Broncos in the Divisional Round. Meanwhile, the New England Patriots will play their Divisional Round game on Sunday.

The Bills have one of the best quarterbacks in the NFL, but have not been able to get over the hump with Josh Allen. One of their biggest flaws as a team is that they lack a true No. 1 receiver. That is one of the reasons they failed to win the division over the Patriots.

Their leading receiver this season was Khalil Shakir, who had 719 yards on 72 receptions. The Bills have failed to replace Stefon Diggs after losing him. However, they can land a star this offseason. ESPN‚Äôs Ben Solak predicted they would trade for A.J. Brown.

‚ÄúA year after general manager Brandon Beane‚Äôs emphatic statement that they didn‚Äôt need a WR1 went over disastrously, Buffalo will tilt and get aggressive,‚Äù Solak wrote on Saturday. ‚ÄúThe Bills will trade a first-round pick and then some for Philadelphia‚Äôs A.J. Brown, believing he can be the final player to push their offense over the edge.‚Äù

Brown‚Äôs issues with the Philadelphia Eagles have been well documented. Multiple times this season, he expressed frustration with his role. In the Eagles‚Äô final game, he was seen arguing with Nick Sirianni on the sideline.

Brown made multiple trade requests last season, according to Joseph Santoliquito of SB Nation. General manager Howie Roseman downplayed trade rumors after the Eagles‚Äô season ended, but many teams could call about Brown.

https://open.spotify.com/episode/2Mf6wJm47JSXK22DVoVot4

His outbursts and frustration have been going on for a few seasons at this point. He is still an elite receiver and could put up monster numbers with Allen in Buffalo. The Bills getting Brown could be a problem for the Patriots.

Brown is a three-time Pro Bowler and three-time Second-Team All-Pro. He has surpassed 1,000 yards every season of his career except one. He had 869 yards in 2021, but missed multiple games.

In four seasons with the Eagles, he has 5,034 yards and 32 touchdowns in the regular season. He could make the Bills an even bigger threat to the Patriots in the AFC East.

The Patriots are also contenders to land Brown if he is traded. They do not need him as badly as other teams, but his connection to Mike Vrabel certainly makes the Patriots a landing spot.

Former Patriots Receiver Defends Josh Allen After Bills‚Äô Playoff Exit

title: Jeong scores late as Union Berlin draws 1-1 at Stuttgart
description: Substitute Jeong Woo-yeong scored a late equalizer as Union Berlin snatched a point with a 1-1 draw at Stuttgart in the German league on Sunday.  Chris F√ºhrich had put the hosts ahead near the hour-mark before Jeong‚Äôs equalizer in the 83rd minute extended Union's unbeaten run to five matches.  Stuttgart missed the chance to move into the top three.
fullText:
BERLIN (AP) ‚Äî Substitute Jeong Woo-yeong scored a late equalizer as Union Berlin snatched a point with a 1-1 draw at Stuttgart in the German league on Sunday.

Chris F√ºhrich had put the hosts ahead near the hour-mark before Jeong‚Äôs equalizer in the 83rd minute extended Union's unbeaten run to five matches.

Stuttgart missed the chance to move into the top three. Sebastian Hoeness‚Äô team is fourth in the standings, level on points with third-placed Hoffenheim, which has one match in hand.

The hosts dominated early on ‚Äî with Union threatening on the break ‚Äî and took the lead when Ramon Hendriks set up F√ºhrich, who slotted home with right-footed strike.

Jeong came on in the 75th minute and the South Korea midfielder scored against his former club with a precise finish into the top corner.

Bayern Munich, which routed Leipzig 5-1 on Saturday, tops the standings with an 11-point lead. Second-placed Borussia Dortmund scraped past St. Pauli 3-2 on Saturday after letting a two-goal lead slip.

AP soccer: https://apnews.com/hub/soccer

title: Liam Rosenior names Chelsea player who has impressed him more than expected
description: Liam Rosenior is still putting his squad together at Chelsea, and there are players who are making a strong early impression. The move for a new centre-back appears to be gathering momentum.
fullText:
Liam Rosenior is still putting his squad together at Chelsea, and there are players who are making a strong early impression.

The move for a new centre-back appears to be gathering momentum.

The pursuit of Jeremy Jacquet has advanced today, with reports suggesting that Chelsea have agreed personal terms with the defender. However, there may be an issue over the fee, which stands at ¬£60 million.

Even so, it is encouraging to see investment in a position that needed strengthening, especially after initial plans had been to wait until summer.

Chelsea will also want to avoid any major departures during January as they continue building under Rosenior. The focus remains on adding depth rather than losing key pieces mid-season.

Nothing ever seems set in stone at Chelsea, but for the moment, things are looking positive for Enzo Fernandez.

Paris Saint-Germain have shown interest and made an approach, but even they know pulling him away from Stamford Bridge will not be easy.

Rosenior has made it clear how much he values Fernandez. After the win against Brentford, he shared his thoughts on the Argentine star: ‚ÄúSo impressed. I knew what an outstanding player he was. It‚Äôs not until you see a player up close to see what he‚Äôs all about. He‚Äôs a winner.

‚ÄúIt‚Äôs his birthday today so I told him he should go to a steakhouse and enjoy some Argentine steak. He‚Äôs an important player.‚Äù

Enzo Fernandez has taken big steps forward in his attacking play over the last year.

Since the start of the previous season, he has been involved in 36 goals across all competitions ‚Äì more than any other Chelsea player, even Cole Palmer.

This campaign, he has already matched his best-ever total with six Premier League goals.

In 2025, he created more chances (51) than anyone else at the club and spent most of the year leading the league in open-play chances created.

His showing against Brentford was another reminder of how much he contributes to this side.

title: Braves $38M clubhouse leader, Gold Glove winner, World Series champion could retire after 2026 season
description: It could be nearing the end of the line for this Braves fan favorite.
fullText:
Braves $38M clubhouse leader, Gold Glove winner, World Series champion could retire after 2026 season originally appeared on The Sporting News. Add The Sporting News as a Preferred Source by clicking here.

The Atlanta Braves have done fairly well this offseason, with most of their major moves coming early. However, if there is one area where the Braves can still improve, it is the starting rotation. Braves GM Alex Anthopoulos isn‚Äôt just looking for any starter ‚Äî he wants someone capable of starting a playoff game in October.

‚ÄúWe‚Äôve explored the starting rotation, adding and getting some type of starter, whether that‚Äôs trade or signing. We‚Äôd like for it to be someone impactful, someone we think can start a playoff game,‚Äù Anthopoulos said.

The Braves are usually known for having a strong rotation, but last season was different as injuries piled up throughout the year. Looking ahead to 2026, the rotation appears to be in good shape, but it‚Äôs the years beyond that where things get interesting for Atlanta.

‚ÄúBeyond Spencer Strider and Spencer Schwellenbach, there are no clear locks for the Atlanta Braves rotation beyond 2026,‚Äô‚Äù HTHB‚Äôs Chase Owens wrote.

One big name to monitor beyond this season is veteran Chris Sale. With Sale nearing his 40s, it will be interesting to see how he evaluates where he is in his career once the season concludes. HTHB‚Äôs Steven Teal believes Sale could be done with baseball if he has a strong 2026 campaign.

‚ÄúAs far as his health goes, Atlanta's training staff, along with Sale making some lifestyle changes, has helped keep him on the field successfully. As mentioned above, his rib injury was just a freak thing as he made a great diving play against the Mets, hoping for a complete game. Had that injury not occurred, Sale would have likely completed the season and thrown over 170 innings again. There's no reason to believe he won't be as good this season for the Braves. If he pitches well enough, he could complete his career,‚Äù Teal wrote.

While losing Sale would undoubtedly hurt, the veteran starter has put together an outstanding career and has little left to prove. During his time with the Braves, he has largely silenced critics who labeled him as injury-prone.

Sale has also been a valuable mentor in the clubhouse and within the pitching staff, but there is a real possibility that this season could be the end of the line for him. If so, the Braves may soon be saying goodbye to one of their most respected clubhouse leaders.

title: Manchester City Women Storm Into FA Cup Fifth Round
description: Blue Girls Thump Cherries on South Coast
fullText:
Manchester City Women made light work of Bournemouth as they cruised into the fifth round of the FA Cup. Bunny Shaw opened the scoring before three goals in four minutes from Lauren Hemp and a double by Laura Coombs, sent City in 4-0 up at the interval. Vivianne Miedema got on the scoresheet with a second-half brace as Andree Jeglertz‚Äô side extended their unbeaten run to 16 games in all competitions.

City had struggled last weekend against Everton in their first match after the international break, but ultimately came away with a 2-0 victory to remain top of the WSL. But there were no such problems against the National League South side, although the Cherries did pose City some problems at the start, with Jenna Markham trying her luck, with Khiara Keating saving well.

City then began to show their WSL quality and it was no surprise when Bunny Shaw headed the Blues in front in the 19th minute.¬†Leila Ouahabi‚Äôs brilliant cross into the box was perfect for Shaw, and the Jamaican powered home a header to give City the lead.

The Blues continued to press but Bournemouth, despite being a goal down, were holding their own, and they would have been happy going into the break just a goal down. However, a flurry of goals in the space of four minutes ended any hopes of a comeback. Lauren Hemp drilled into the bottom right corner, before Coombs hit a two-minute brace to effectively put the Blues into the fifth round.

Miedema got in on the act in the 58th minute, soon after Yui Hasegawa thundered a shot against the bar, tapping into an empty net thanks to a fortuitous deflection off Lily Murphy. The Dutch striker then put the Cherries to bed and one on the cake as she thumped home in the 85th minute.

In the end it was a routine victory for Jeglertz‚Äôs side and City will now go into their League Cup Tie with Chelsea on Wednesday full of confidence and eager to test themselves against the current WSL champions, in preparation for their upcoming tussle in the WSL at the beginning of February.

Final Score: Bournemouth Women 0-6 Manchester City Women

title: NFL insider names Falcons' likely choice for offensive coordinator
description: NFL insider says Tommy Rees likely to be named Falcons offensive coordinator
fullText:
The Atlanta Falcons have found their next head coach, hiring Kevin Stefanski on Saturday night after interviewing nine total candidates for the vacancy. Next up, Stefanski will look to fill out his coaching staff. There already have been a few names linked to Atlanta.

The Falcons are expected to hire Bill Callahan as offensive line coach and retain defensive coordinator Jeff Ulbrich, but what about Atlanta's offensive coordinator position. Zac Robinson is unlikely to return and has already interviewed for three other vacancies.

According to a report from NFL Network's Ian Rapoport, Stefanski is eyeing Tommy Rees to be the team's new offensive coordinator. Rees served as Cleveland's offensive coordinator in 2025, working closely with Stefanski.

Prior to joining the Browns staff in 2024, Rees was the offensive coordinator and quarterbacks coach at Alabama in 2023, and held the same role at Notre Dame from 2020-2023.

From @NFLGameDay Morning: The #Falcons hired coach Kevin Stefanski as their next head coach, and his staff is already coming together. pic.twitter.com/Q2DvRUGobE

‚Äî Ian Rapoport (@RapSheet) January 18, 2026

Stefanski is an experienced play-caller, and most assume he will continue to call plays in Atlanta. The Falcons had a similar situation with head coach Arthur Smith, who also served as the team's play-caller from 2021-2023.

This article originally appeared on Falcons Wire: Atlanta Falcons: Tommy Rees to be named offensive coordinator?

title: In honor of Bob Uecker, here‚Äôs a few stories
description: Uecker passed away a year ago this weekend. To honor his memory, here are some of my favorite stories.
fullText:
Legendary announcer Bob Uecker, the voice of the Milwaukee Brewers for over 50 years, passed away a year ago on Friday. Uecker was widely regarded as one of the greatest sports announcers ever. He also had a knack for sharing ‚Äî and, through his actions, creating ‚Äî funny, often self-deprecating stories.

In the spirit of keeping his memory alive, I wanted to compile a few of my favorites. If I missed one of your favorites, drop it in the comments.

‚ÄúIn 1962, I was named Minor League Player of the Year. It was my second season in the bigs.‚Äù

‚ÄúOne time, I got pulled over at 4 a.m. I was fined $75 for being intoxicated and $400 for being with the Phillies.‚Äù

‚ÄúI led the league in go get ‚Äôem next time.‚Äù

‚ÄúI led the league in hit-by-pitches one year. That‚Äôs because I couldn‚Äôt get out of the way.‚Äù

‚ÄúThey told me to block the plate. I laid down. That seemed safest.‚Äù

‚ÄúI was so bad, they once traded me for myself.‚Äù

‚ÄúThe only way I could make the team was because I knew where the beer was kept.‚Äù

‚ÄúThe highlight of my career was getting out of the bullpen without falling down.‚Äù

‚ÄúCareer highlights? I had two. I got an intentional walk from¬†Sandy Koufax,¬†and I got out of a rundown against the¬†Mets.‚Äù

‚ÄúIf a guy hits .300 every year, what does he have to look forward to? I always tried to stay around .190, with three or four RBI. And I tried to get them all in September. That way I always had something to talk about during the winter.‚Äù

‚ÄúI thought silence meant I was fired. Then I realized baseball already has enough pauses. I just filled the funny ones.‚Äù

‚ÄúMy baseball card had my picture on the front and my career statistics on the back. That way you could turn it over and laugh twice.‚Äù

‚ÄúI knew when my career was over. In 1965, my baseball card came out with no picture.‚Äù

On his favorite aspect of playing professional baseball:

‚ÄúIt was the free food. I hit .200 but ate like an All-Star.‚Äù

‚ÄúI used to get sore after games. Now I get sore watching them.‚Äù

‚ÄúI Hope That Guy Puts His Shirt On‚Äù

‚ÄúI have no recollection of what year this was, where the Brewers were playing, or any other context. All I remember is that we‚Äôre returning from the commercial break, Uecker is welcoming us back into the booth saying something like ‚ÄòWelcome back to [Whatever Stadium we‚Äôre in] the score is [Whatever].‚Äò Then, apropos of nothing, ‚ÄòMan! I hope that guy puts his shirt back on.‚Äô

To be clear: Uecker had not mentioned this shirtless buffoon before in the broadcast, or brought him up afterward. He just was annoyed by a guy, and he wanted us all to know about it.

‚ÄúYou know, everybody remembers their first game in the major leagues. For me it was in Milwaukee. My hometown, born and raised there, and I can remember walking out on the field and¬†Birdie Tebbetts¬†was our manager at that time. And my family was there: my mother and dad, and all my relatives. And as I‚Äôm standing on the field, everybody‚Äôs pointing at me and waving and laughing, and I‚Äôm pointing back. And¬†Tebbetts came up and asked me if I was nervous or uptight about the game. And I said, ‚ÄòI‚Äôm not. I‚Äôve been waiting five years to get here. I‚Äôm ready to go.‚Äô

He said, ‚ÄòWell, we‚Äôre gonna start you today. I didn‚Äôt want to tell you earlier. I didn‚Äôt want you to get too fired up.‚Äô

I said, ‚ÄòLook, I‚Äôm ready to go.‚Äô

He said, ‚ÄòWell, great, you‚Äôre in there. And oh, by the by, the rest of us up here wear that supporter on the inside.‚Äô That was the first game my folks walked out on, too.‚Äù

From Brewers broadcaster Lane Grindle:

‚ÄúUsinger‚Äôs Famous Sausage is a big sponsor on the radio and another sponsor is Cedar Crest Ice Cream. A lot of our messaging combines the two of them. They deliver a lot of their products to the booth. One night on the air, Ueck was talking about how we had some sherbet that we had had out, and we were trying it earlier in the day. And then he says, ‚ÄòYou know, as a matter of fact, I think it‚Äôs so good you could put it on a sausage and it would be good.‚Äô It kind of devolved into, like, well, let‚Äôs all try this ‚Ä¶ Let‚Äôs actually put sherbet on a brat and eat it tonight, taste test it and then report on air how it is. It was raspberry sherbet, and we used it like it was mustard or ketchup. Honestly, it wasn‚Äôt bad. We all kind of liked it.‚Äù

From former Brewers broadcaster Jim Powell:

‚ÄúThis would never happen with any other partner that I would ever have.

We would just get on the bus to go to the stadium, you know, 3:30 in the afternoon, for a 7 p.m. game. We were in Montreal to play the Expos. I don‚Äôt know why he saw that as like a clean palette on which he could go to town, but he did. So on the bus ride, he would start reading the billboards, you know as the bus was passing along, and he sort of developed a character, just goofing off on the bus rides. This happened over multiple years. After a while, it became pretty refined. Like, he was really funny with this character. So I had to do a pregame interview for every game. And I asked him, ‚ÄòHey, what do you think about if I interview you on the pregame show, and you‚Äôre in that character? ‚ÄôAnd he‚Äôs like, ‚ÄòNo, no, no, I‚Äôm not doing it for that.‚Äô I said, ‚ÄòThat‚Äôs fine; it doesn‚Äôt have to go on the air. What if we just do an interview just for us to laugh at?‚Äô Under that circumstance, he was fine with it.

So we did this interview, and out of nowhere, I just plucked what I thought was a French Canadian type of name, Jean Jacques Smythe. So I do this interview with Jean Jacques Smythe, who was, as I labeled him in the interview, a renowned French Canadian journalist, highly esteemed, blah, blah, blah. When we start, he did something he had never done on the bus. He became completely hostile. He started ripping me. He was ripping the commissioner of baseball, (former Brewers owner) Bud Selig. Anybody he could think of. He was anti-everything. For whatever reason, that‚Äôs the way he took the character in this interview. Of course, the best part was he began to rip himself. And it was absolutely hysterical.‚Äù

You can find (one of) the Jean Jacques Smythe interviews here.

‚ÄúAfter each game, I would be doing the postgame show on radio. He would be packing up his suitcase and preparing to leave the booth. His big goal was to try to get me to laugh out loud, on the air, while I am doing out-of-town scores or recapping, playing highlights from the Brewers game we just did. And it was absolutely hysterical the things he would do. He would, for example, stand right behind me, and make a sound. Like a wounded seal or a wounded dog. He would bark.¬†Ar roof. Ar roof. Ar roof.

Sometimes he would use props. I‚Äôm live on the air broadcasting, and I‚Äôm trying to maintain my composure and be a professional. One time, he said, ‚ÄòHey, Pat, look over here.‚Äô And I knew it was going to be something bizarre. I turned around and there‚Äôs pretzels sticking out of both of his ears.

That was his big goal, to try to get me to laugh out loud. Once I laughed, then he‚Äôd say, ‚ÄòOK, see you tomorrow.‚Äô‚Äù

From former Brewers catcher and current announcer Bill Schroeder:

‚ÄúThis is an example of how Ueck can relate to just about anybody, I mean, presidents and pillars of industry and just a guy on the street. We would go to dinner in Pittsburgh and people would come up to him, and it was not easy being Ueck. Everybody expected him to be on his game, right? He had to be funny. But this one time after a game in Pittsburgh, Ueck was in the Fish Market, which was the bar at the hotel where we were staying at. It just so happened that the furries were in town. You know, the people that dressed up in these animal outfits? So I walk into the Fish Market and I see Bob Uecker sitting at the bar, and he‚Äôs having a conversation with a guy dressed up in a horse head. And the person next to him was in a cat suit. Ueck was like, talking to Trigger, and, you know, Felix the Cat is right next to him. He‚Äôs having a conversation with these guys like no big deal.

And that, it‚Äôs an image that I‚Äôll never forget. It‚Äôs just an example of how Ueck could just take a situation and make it fun and not make it uncomfortable. And he did that for thousands and thousands of people, and that‚Äôs one thing I‚Äôm really going to miss about Ueck.‚Äù

title: Ruud Gullit questions if Chelsea is ‚Äúright club‚Äù for ‚Äúdevelopment‚Äù of ¬£35.5m Blues ace
description: Former Chelsea player and manager Ruud Gullit has questioned whether Stamford Bridge is the right place for Jorrel Hato to develop.Chelsea signed Hato from Ajax last summer in a deal worth an initial ...
fullText:
Former Chelsea player and manager Ruud Gullit has questioned whether Stamford Bridge is the right place for Jorrel Hato to develop.

Chelsea signed Hato from Ajax last summer in a deal worth an initial ¬£35.5m, with the Dutch international regarded as one of the best young defenders in Europe.

Hato was signed to provide much needed back-up to Marc Cucurella at left back, and he‚Äôs filled a vital gap in the squad.

Hato has made 14 appearances in all competitions this season, but was used sparingly under former head coach Enzo Maresca.

However, the 19-year-old has featured in all three games under Liam Rosenior, and on early evidence seems to be trusted more by the Englishman.

Hato scored his first goal against Charlton. (Photo by Julian Finney/Getty Images)

Hato scored his first goal for the club against Charlton, and it will be interesting to see what opportunities he gets over the second half of the season.

Rosenior was impressed by what he saw from Hato against Charlton, but Gullit has questioned whether Chelsea is the right place for his development.

‚ÄúI had doubts about his transfer to Chelsea,‚Äù he told Tribal Football.

‚ÄúHe was one of the best young players in Holland, and sometimes it‚Äôs better to stay longer and gain experience.

‚ÄúHe was captain at Ajax at such a young age, but Ajax were struggling. He escaped a difficult situation at Ajax.

‚ÄúHe saw it coming and thought it was the right time to leave. I don‚Äôt know if Chelsea is the right club for his development.‚Äù

Whilst one young defender in Hato is continuing to settle in at Chelsea, the Blues are looking to add another in Jeremy Jacquet.

Ruud Gullit questions if Chelsea is ‚Äúright club‚Äù for ‚Äúdevelopment‚Äù of ¬£35.5m Blues ace

‚ÄúTalks taking place‚Äù ‚Äì Fabrizio Romano shares transfer update on ‚Ç¨20m Chelsea star

Romano: Chelsea ‚Äúagreed personal terms‚Äù with top target, negotiating team already in France

Chelsea have changed their transfer plans and are looking to bring in a centre back this month, and have identified Jacquet as their main target.

The Blues have reportedly agreed personal terms with Jacquet, but Rennes want ‚Ç¨65m for the 20-year-old, whilst Chelsea aren‚Äôt prepared to spend that much currently.

title: MMA Mania‚Äôs 2025 BJJ Awards: Best Male Grapplers of the Year
description: Here are BJJ‚Äôs top male grapplers of 2025.
fullText:
2025 has been a banner year for Brazilian jiu-jitsu (BJJ), as the sport rapidly grows and more opportunities are available for athletes in the professional grappling scene. We‚Äôre going over some of the best performances and top milestones of the year, as we unveil the winners of the 2025 BJJ Awards here at MMA Mania.

Following up on our¬†Submission,¬†Event,¬†Breakthrough Grappler,¬†Promotion,¬†and Female Grappler of the Year awards, our final category tackles the best male grapplers of 2025.

This award isn‚Äôt necessarily given to the highest ranked or most skilled grappler, but who we believe had the best year in 2025. There were several elite grapplers that put on great performances throughout the year, but here are the top grapplers that stood out the most.

Diego ‚ÄúPato‚Äù Oliveira and Adam Wardzinski both had an incredible year, as the two BJJ stars took gold at all four major gi events (IBJJF Worlds, Pans, Brasileiros and Euros) in 2025 to win IBJJF Grand Slam honors.

Pato won his 6th IBJJF world title across gi and no gi, and also had one WNO title defense over Keith Krikorian last year. Wardzinski won back to back world titles in 2024 and 2025, before retiring from the IBJJF circuit in the best way possible. They have good cases to be ranked higher, as they‚Äôre world champs and legitimately among the top pound-for-pound best today. They arguably had better years though and they each sustained upset losses in the few high paying (for BJJ) professional tournaments they joined.

Pato and Wardzinski are so good and both operate on such high expectations that those rare losses actually elevated the careers of two breakhrough athletes.

Declan Moody had a huge year, where he rose from a promising BJJ prospect to legitimately one of the best heavyweights on the planet. Moody‚Äôs game seems to have significantly improved in 2025, and the results speak for themselves. With his great passing, movement and quickness for his size, the 29-year-old B-Team product was dominant in several key tournaments and professional events.

In 2025, Moody beat five men to win CJI 2 Trials, submitted Fellipe Andrew at WNO 28, then dominated Ryan Aitken and Ethan Crelinsten at CJI 2. A week later, and he beat Marcin Maciulewicz and four others to win another ADCC Trials gold medal.

Moody then capped off the year by winning the WNO Open Weight Grand Prix title. He has a legitimate case to be ranked higher, but either way, Moody clearly had one of the best showings in 2025 due to his vastly improved game.

2025 was absolutely massive for Andrew Tackett‚Äôs career.

He started the year with a heel hook win at WNO 27, before eventually joining UFC BJJ and being part of their ‚ÄúRoad to the Title‚Äù reality show. Tackett beat Aaron Wilson, Jason Nolf and Andy Varela to win the promotion‚Äôs inaugural welterweight belt, and followed up with two title defenses over Renato Canuto and Elijah Dorsey to end the year.

All six of those pro wins were by submission, with Tackett not only living up to his reputation for must watch entertainment, but also growing to become the face of UFC BJJ, along with Mikey Musumeci.

Since becoming a fan-favorite after his 2024 loss to Kade Ruotolo at CJI 1, Tackett took full advantage of the UFC marketing machine and became one of the biggest stars in the entire sport in 2025. Others on this list may technically have more top ranked wins, but Tackett easily had one of the biggest career jumps in 2025.

In 2025, Dorian Olivarez made a massive leap from teen prodigy to elite BJJ talent.

Olivarez was one of the standouts at the biggest BJJ event of the year. While it went down on his official record as draws due to CJI 2‚Äôs team grappling rules, Olivarez clearly dominated three BJJ champions in Ethan Crelinsten, Taylor Pearman and Felipe Pena.

Pearman is an ADCC Trials champ at 88 kg (194 lbs) and came in at 99 kg (218 lbs) for CJI 2, while Pena is the reigning ADCC heavyweight champion (over 99 kg). Olivarez was around 70-80 lbs lighter, further highlighting just how insane those performances were.

In his own 66 kg division, Olivarez also won gold at arguably the most stacked ADCC Trials bracket of the year, which had 130 competitors. He beat seven men in one day, which included submission wins over Julian Espinosa and Gavin Corbe.

In 2025, Olivarez dominated much larger, elite champions at the star-studded CJI 2 event, and he also became a rare two-time ADCC Trials champ ‚Äî all before even turning 20-years-old.

Despite his young age, Olivarez technically doesn‚Äôt qualify for our Breakthrough Grappler of the Year award due to his previous ADCC Trials win (like Declan Moody above). He still did more than enough to win the biggest recognition on our 2025 BJJ Awards though.

With his incredible 2025, Dorian Olivarez is our Male Grappler of the Year.

For the latest Brazilian jiu-jitsu (BJJ) and grappling-related news click¬†here.¬†For additional grappling content, follow¬†@BJJBeat on Instagram.

title: When is the next AFCON? Year, host country of Africa Cup of Nations finals
description: The next Africa Cup of Nations will be one of the last before the switch to a four-year cycle.
fullText:
When is the next AFCON? Year, host country of Africa Cup of Nations finals originally appeared on The Sporting News. Add The Sporting News as a Preferred Source by clicking here.

The 2025 Africa Cup of Nations in Morocco has produced an entertaining month of football across December and January.

The final on January 18 sees the host nation take on a hugely impressive Senegal side in what promises to be a fiercely contested match.

AFCON fans will not have long to wait until the next edition of the tournament ‚Äî indeed, qualifying starts in March 2026 ‚Äî but the cycle will soon be changing to be 

Below, the Sporting News looks at when and where the next AFCON takes place.

MORE:Most AFCON titles in history¬†| Top goal-scorers at 2025 AFCON in Morocco

The next Africa Cup of Nations will be held in 2027.

Unlike the previous edition, it will take place during the summer months of the northern hemisphere. The precise dates are yet to be confirmed, but the tournament will be held across June and July.

The 2027 AFCON will be co-hosted by Kenya, Uganda, and Tanzania. It will be the first time the tournament has ever been staged across three host nations.

The event will mark the competition's 70th anniversary, and it will be the last to be played in an odd-numbered year. From 2028 onwards, the AFCON will move to a quadrennial format, like the World Cup.

MORE:Why the AFCON is moving to a four-year cycle

There are 10 proposed host cities for the 2027 tournament: three each in Kenya and Uganda, and four in Tanzania.

Five of the proposed venues are under construction, including the Talanta Sports Stadium in Kenya's capital, Nairobi.

*Final host cities and venues are yet to be confirmed.

Moi International Sports Centre

The hosts of the 2028 tournament have not yet been chosen. As of January 2026, the two confirmed bids for hosting rights were from Ethiopia, and a joint proposal from Botswana and South Africa (with Namibia reportedly a potential third joint-host).

The Africa Cup of Nations began in 1957 and has been played at least every two years since 1968.

title: ‚ÄòThere are a lot of good players here‚Äô ‚Äì Juliano Belletti reacts to Dro Fernandez‚Äôs Barcelona exit
description: The Barcelona Atletic coach does not lack for options.
fullText:
Barcelona Atletic coach Juliano Belletti has spoken about Dro Fernandez‚Äôs decision to leave the club for PSG and admits he only found out from his staff.

The teenager has shocked Barcelona and seemingly upset Hansi Flick with his decision, but Belletti seems far more relaxed about the situation and says there are plenty more options in La Masia.

‚ÄúHe has not communicated anything to me, I have found out from my staff, who have told me before. There are a lot of good players here. I think the club, especially at the moment, is very good in this sense,‚Äù he told Prioritat Filial.‚Äú

‚ÄúWe see how Juan Hern√°ndez, Dani, Cuenca, √Ålvaro are playing‚Ä¶ There are many options here. There is a very important competitiveness within the club and that is good for the coach. And for the players, because it makes them look to improve. We are all working to make sure that they are ready for the first team.‚Äù

Fernandez‚Äôs move to PSG is expected to be completed in the coming days, with the youngster signing a contract until 2030 with the Ligue 1 side.

title: NFL Divisional Sunday Discussion: Hate-watching the Bears against Rams
description: Packers fans will be hoping that old friend Davante Adams can help bring the Bears‚Äô season to an end.
fullText:
Green Bay Packers fans saw their team bomb out of the playoffs last Saturday, giving up 25 fourth-quarter points to the Chicago Bears in a brutal 31-27 loss. With that result, the Bears advanced to this weekend‚Äôs Divisional Playoffs, where they face a Los Angeles Rams team that is, in the eyes of many NFL analysts, the best team in the NFL.

The Rams had to scrape and claw their way to a win in their own Wild Card game, however, scoring a late touchdown to defeat the Carolina Panthers 34-31 on the road. That game saw those two teams trade scores throughout the fourth quarter, but it was Matthew Stafford‚Äôs connection to Colby Parkinson with 38 seconds left that proved to be the difference.

Packers fans would surely love to see an old friend knock the Bears out of the postseason, however. Davante Adams is the #2 option in the Rams‚Äô passing game behind Puka Nacua, and tonight‚Äôs game would be a perfect time for Adams to deliver a classic performance. In 17 career games against the Bears (16 with the Packers and one with the Raiders), Adams has totaled 88 catches for 1,081 yards and ten touchdowns ‚Äî a very solid full season‚Äôs worth of numbers.

Adams‚Äô last game against the Bears while wearing green and gold came in December of 2021. In that contest, he roasted Chicago‚Äôs secondary with 10 receptions, 121 yards, and two touchdowns. His only better game against Chicago was in late 2016, when he caught 13 balls for 132 and two scores. All told, Adams had four 100-yard games when playing the Bears. If he can do anything like that again tonight, the Rams should be headed to the NFC Championship.

Of course, that game comes after the AFC‚Äôs 2-5 matchup, which puts one of the league‚Äôs best defenses in the Houston Texans against the potential MVP, Patriots quarterback Drake Maye. That should be a fun game to watch as a relatively neutral observer before turning into big-time Rams fans for the final game of the weekend.

Join us in the comments to discuss both games!

Game Time: 3:00 PM Eastern Time (2:00 PM Central)
TV Channel: ESPN & ABC
Commentators: Joe Buck, Troy Aikman
Point spread: Patriots -3

Game Time: 5:30 PM Central Time
TV Channel: NBC
Commentators: Mike Tirico, Cris Collinsworth
Point spread: Rams -3.5

title: Mario Cristobal addresses Xavier Lucas targeting suspension ahead of national championship game
description: The Miami Hurricanes head into the College Football Playoff national championship game with some pretty good news on the injury front. Elija Lofton has been ruled out, and Damari Brown appears to be trending towards a game time decision, but every other contributor avoided being on the availability report and appears good to go, including [‚Ä¶]
fullText:
The Miami Hurricanes head into the College Football Playoff national championship game with some pretty good news on the injury front. Elija Lofton has been ruled out, and Damari Brown appears to be trending towards a game time decision, but every other contributor avoided being on the availability report and appears good to go, including Ahmad Moten, Sr., Akheem Mesidor, and OJ Frederique.

However, thanks to college football‚Äôs own controversial rule, the Hurricanes‚Äô defense will still have to try to hold the Indiana Hoosiers in check without one of their most important players ‚Äì starting cornerback Xavier Lucas.

Lucas was flagged for targeting in the second half of Miami‚Äôs 31-27 win over Ole Miss in the Fiesta Bowl. He hit Ole Miss WR Cayden Lee with his shoulder, but the contact occurred to Lee‚Äôs head, and Lucas was sent to the showers.

It‚Äôs not being talked about enough how ridiculous it is that Xavier Lucas has to sit out the first half of the title game because he tried to tackle the lower body of a receiver being led into him by his QB as the WR twisted his body down into his helmet.pic.twitter.com/oT3F5l3lnr

‚Äî David Furones (@DavidFurones_) January 16, 2026

Based on the NCAA‚Äôs rule, Lucas is suspended for the first half of Monday night‚Äôs clash with the Indiana Hoosiers. It feels like a heavy and unfair penalty because it is, particularly given it wasn‚Äôt an intentional and egregious hit. At some point as a defender, you have to commit to going into a hit, and a wide receiver‚Äôs body position changes in a millisecond, and some guys just miss. This was an example of exactly that. Now, as a result of playing football, Lucas will be watching with his helmet in his hand for the first 30 minutes.

Mario Cristobal was asked about the hit on Sunday morning at his joint press conference with Indiana‚Äôs Curt Cignetti, and he feels as though the rule should be revisited.

‚ÄúCertainly do. We feel it was unjustly administered, and now it impacts the last game of the season. We do have the ability, again, as an officiating crew and the powers that be to revisit that to give every team due process and their best ability to compete in this game.‚Äú

Indiana‚Äôs offense is a handful, with Omar Cooper, Jr. Elijah Sarratt, and Charlie Becker forming a terrific trio of pass catchers. Miami is being severely hamstrung by this rule. Hopefully for Miami‚Äôs sakes, they can continue to control the game on offense early on with long, sustained drives and keep Indiana‚Äôs offense on the sideline.

Because if they don‚Äôt, an already extremely tough offense will be even tougher for the Hurricanes to stop. And on the game‚Äôs biggest stage, that‚Äôs a real shame.

title: Jon Jones responds to Alex Pereira's online shot: 'Be careful'
description: Jon Jones responds to fellow UFC legend Alex Pereira's post, targeting him for a fight.
fullText:
Alex Pereira took a shot at UFC legend Jon Jones, and he got a response.

Pereira, current UFC light heavyweight champion and one of the biggest names in MMA today, has been making the rounds on social media due to him going back to the tire shop he used to work at in Brazil prior to his explosion to fame in UFC. Not only is it a rags-to-riches story that has captivated the MMA world, but "Poatan" made sure to spice things up. He posted a video of a tire that had written, "Jon Jones next" with a hammer next to it that had "Poatan" on it.

This not only got the attention of fans, but also Jones himself.

"I've beat a lot of legends from your country, my friend. I know you'd love to avenge the boys, but boy would you be a good one to add to my list. Be careful what you wish for. Chama."

Jon Jones sent a warning to Alex Pereira üò¨ https://t.co/eq7a9n1etE pic.twitter.com/2EaHKXr1sc

‚Äî Happy Punch (@HappyPunch) January 18, 2026

Friction between Jones and Pereira is nothing new. This is the latest of years of the two publicly showing interest in fighting each other. Talks of a potential bout between the two were at the highest when Jones defended the UFC heavyweight crown against Stipe Miocic in November 2024, and Pereira held the UFC light heavyweight belt. In the end, the highly-anticipated superfight never materialized with Jones vacating his belt and retiring, just to unretire a few months later.

There's been talk of a potential fight between the two at the UFC's expected event at The White House in June. Jones claims he's out of retirement, and Pereira still holds the UFC light heavyweight belt after losing it and re-gaining it in 2025 in a two-fight series with Magomed Ankalaev.

This article originally appeared on MMA Junkie: Jon Jones responds to Alex Pereira's online shot: 'Be careful'

title: Russian football legend accuses Barcelona of not signing him because he was ‚Äòugly‚Äô
description: Viktor Onopko is regarded as one of the most gifted footballers Russia has produced. He was a footballing icon for the country, especially in the 90s.Currently serving as the assistant manager of the ...
fullText:
Viktor Onopko is regarded as one of the most gifted footballers Russia has produced. He was a footballing icon for the country, especially in the 90s.

Currently serving as the assistant manager of the Russian national football team, Onopko has raised a few eyebrows with his statement about Barcelona.

In a recent interview with El Bigote de Abad√≠a, Onopko revealed that he was linked to Barcelona at one point in his career. But he accused Bar√ßa of not signing him because he was ‚Äòugly‚Äô.

Onopko arrived in Spain in 1996, signing for Real Oviedo. He spent six years at Oviedo, featuring in 222 competitive matches before joining Rayo Vallecano in 2002.

A centre-back by trade, Onopko played for Vallecano for just one year before returning to his native Russia, signing for Spartak Alania. He eventually retired in 2006.

‚ÄúI signed with Oviedo in the summer of 1995, but then I went in the winter. I wanted to put a clause that if a club put in one more dollar, I could go to that club.

Onopko claims he was rejected by Barcelona due to aesthetic reasons. (Photo by Firo Foto/Getty Images)

‚ÄúThey told me yes, but they deceived me. Because Atleti made an offer for me, but I couldn‚Äôt go to Atleti,‚Äù Onopko began (h/t Forbes).

However, the footballer revealed that he was a subject of interest for Barcelona as well, but one of the assistant coaches found him ugly.

‚ÄúI recently found out that Barcelona wanted to sign me. But¬†[Johan] Cruyff¬†or one of his assistants said I was ugly, and that‚Äôs why they didn‚Äôt sign me,‚Äù he said.

Although the move did not work out for Onopko, he still ended up as a hero in La Liga, featuring in over 200 matches in the Spanish top-flight while representing the Russian national team 109 times.

Aged 56, Onopko has started his coaching career as well and is currently serving as an assistant for Valeriy Karpin for the Russian national team while simultaneously working as an assistant coach for FC Rostov.

title: UNC‚Äôs season is wobbling, and the spotlight is back on Hubert Davis
description: North Carolina‚Äôs defense is unraveling, losses are piling up and Hubert Davis is under increasing scrutiny as ACC play nears.
fullText:
North Carolina‚Äôs season is unraveling before the heart of ACC play even arrives, and Hubert Davis is suddenly facing the most scrutiny of his tenure in Chapel Hill.

Although North Carolina is 14-4 on the season, which isn‚Äôt terrible, the Tar Heels have lost three of their last four games, including an 84-78 loss to Cal that saw the Bears shoot 50% from the field (29-for-58) and a blistering 62.5% from 3-point range (10-for-16). It marked the fourth straight game the Tar Heels have surrendered at least 40% from beyond the arc. Since the start of ACC play, opponents have hit 72 3-pointers against UNC, an average of 14.4 per game.

The Tar Heels‚Äô terrible defensive play isn‚Äôt going to get any better soon, especially with North Carolina yet to reach the heart of ACC play. And given the expectations placed on Carolina going into the season, it could be Hubert Davis‚Äô last season as head coach.

That‚Äôs what many Carolina fans are saying and thinking, and it‚Äôs not unreasonable to do so given the amount of expectations on the Tar Heels entering the season ‚Äî or every season.

However, Davis‚Äô seat isn‚Äôt hot, but it‚Äôs definitely past 80 degrees Fahrenheit.

For starters, Carolina spent $14 million for this season‚Äôs roster that includes Luka Bogavac, Kyan Evans, Henri Veesaar and, of course, Carolina‚Äôs freshman phenom Caleb Wilson.

While Veesaar and Wilson are arguably the ACC‚Äôs best backcourt duo, Bogavac and Evans aren‚Äôt in the starting lineup anymore because of their struggles of late.

And the Tar Heels‚Äô lackluster defense, which has already cost them games ‚Äî and potentially many more ‚Äî is giving Davis‚Äô detractors more reasons to say he shouldn‚Äôt be the head man in Chapel Hill.

The larger issue is the pattern. Davis‚Äô first team stumbled through much of 2021-22 before catching fire, upsetting Duke in Coach K‚Äôs final home game and riding a Cinderella run to the national title game. A year later, North Carolina opened as the preseason No. 1 and ended as the first team in that spot to miss the NCAA Tournament since the field expanded in 1985.

In 2023-24, the Tar Heels regrouped, starting at No. 19, winning the ACC regular-season title and reaching the Sweet 16. Last season, they began at No. 9, faded to unranked and barely reached the NCAA field through the First Four in Dayton.

It‚Äôs a r√©sum√© defined by wild swings ‚Äî something Duke under Jon Scheyer and Virginia under Ryan Odom haven‚Äôt shared ‚Äî and Carolina appears stuck, if not slipping backward.

The lack of consistency is not what Tar Heels fans want. It‚Äôs never easy to replace a legend like Roy Williams, especially for a first-time head coach like Davis.

However, Duke‚Äôs transition from Mike Krzyzewski to Jon Scheyer has been like nothing changed. Scheyer led the Blue Devils to the Final Four last season, and every year the Blue Devils have gotten better.

Virginia has also bounced back extremely quickly under Ryan Odom, and it looks like the Cavaliers are the second-best team in the conference after Duke.

Carolina is not moving forward. It‚Äôs either staying in the same place or going backward.

It‚Äôs pretty simple why he‚Äôs not on the hot seat just yet: The Tar Heels are 14-4, and there are still plenty of games left.

College basketball is a weird sport, and we have seen teams play subpar basketball and take it up a notch as the season goes along.

Two great examples of this are North Carolina‚Äôs 1997 Final Four and 2022 Final Four squads.

The 1997 squad, one that had Vince Carter and Antawn Jamison, started off the season 12-6 before going on a 16-game winning streak and advancing to the Final Four as a No. 1 seed. That team also won four straight games against ranked opponents to close out the regular season, which included wins over Tim Duncan-led No. 4 Wake Forest and No. 7 Duke.

The 2022 team spent most of the season unranked and even lost to an 11-21 Pitt team, giving the Tar Heels an 18-8 record. However, UNC followed the loss to Pitt with a five-game winning streak to end the regular season, including its shocking win over Duke in Coach K‚Äôs final home game in Cameron Indoor Stadium. That kick-started its Cinderella run to the national championship that season.

While Davis‚Äô coaching ability is being questioned right now, the Tar Heels have a lot of time to fix issues that are largely fixable. And while his tenure has been inconsistent, a lot of programs around the country would kill for Davis‚Äô first four years at the helm.

However, time is beginning to run out, and tension is starting to arise in the Southern Part of Heaven.

This article originally appeared on Tar Heels Wire: UNC Basketball: Is Hubert Davis on the hot seat?

title: Lazio hatch plan to beat Juventus & Inter to Verona starlet Giovane
description: Lazio are attempting to steal a march on their Serie A rivals in the race for Hellas Verona forward Giovane, with the Biancocelesti working on a creative solution to move ahead of the competition in J...
fullText:
Lazio are attempting to steal a march on their Serie A rivals in the race for Hellas Verona forward Giovane, with the Biancocelesti working on a creative solution to move ahead of the competition in January.

The 22-year-old attacker has impressed this season with Verona, drawing interest from several top Italian clubs thanks to his pace, mobility and end product.

VERONA, ITALY ‚Äì JANUARY 04: Nikola Vlasic of Torino is challenged by Giovane of Hellas Verona during the Serie A match between Hellas Verona FC and Torino FC at Stadio Marcantonio Bentegodi on January 04, 2026 in Verona, Italy. (Photo by Alessandro Sabattini/Getty Images)

Juventus, Inter and Napoli have all monitored Giovane in recent months, largely with a view to a summer move, but Lazio are now pushing to accelerate talks and close a deal this month.

According to reports from CalcioMercato, Lazio are exploring a swap-based operation to tempt Verona into an early agreement.

The idea would see midfielder Reda Belahyane included as part of the deal, alongside a cash adjustment. Belahyane only joined Lazio from Verona in January 2025, and the clubs retain an open line of communication.

VERONA, ITALY ‚Äì JANUARY 11: Maurizio Sarri head coach during the Serie A match at Stadio Marcantonio Bentegodi on January 11, 2026 in Verona, Italy. (Photo by Alessandro Sabattini/Getty Images)

Maurizio Sarri is keen to add a more dynamic and versatile attacking option to his squad following the arrival of Ratkov, and Giovane is viewed as an ideal profile to complement Lazio‚Äôs existing forwards. Talks between the two clubs are ongoing as they attempt to structure a deal that satisfies Verona‚Äôs valuation.

Giovane, who has registered three goals and four assists in 20 Serie A appearances this season, is expected to command a fee in the region of ‚Ç¨15-18m.

Lazio‚Äôs hope is that the inclusion of Belahyane could lower that figure and allow them to move decisively ahead of rivals such as Inter, Napoli and Juventus.

title: Quins knock out La Rochelle with stunning away win
description: Harlequins stun La Rochelle to claim a place and home advantage in the last 16 of the Champions Cup.
fullText:
Tries: Niniashvili, Nowell, Berjon Con: West

Tries: Murley, Green, Lawday Cons: Smith (3) Pens: Smith (2)

Harlequins stunned La Rochelle to claim a home berth in the last 16 of the Investec Champions Cup and knock out the former champions by denying them a losing bonus point.

A Marcus Smith penalty in the final minute saw Quins to a shock win on the road that also means Leicester Tigers claim fourth place in Pool 3 on points difference.

Tries from Cadan Murley, Tyrone Green and Tom Lawday were all converted by Smith, who spent 10 minutes in the sin-bin during the second half.

La Rochelle took an early lead through Davit Niniashvili, while tries from Jack Nowell and Thomas Berjon in the second half seemed to swing the momentum towards the home side.

Lawday's try on 72 minutes put Quins 24-17 ahead, and Smith's late penalty denied La Rochelle a losing bonus point that would have seen them qualify instead of Leicester, silencing the home crowd at Stade Marcel-Deflandre.

Despite their tough season domestically in the Prem, Quins dug deep to finish in second place behind Leinster and will play at the Stoop in the last 16.

Niniashvili's try, converted by Ihaia West, seemed to set the two-time champions on their way but they could not convert their pressure into more points early on.

Smith's penalty got Quins going, and they led at half-time thanks to a try from Murley's dive over next to the corner flag, nimbly converted by Smith.

Chandler Cunningham-South's bust and deft pass then set up Green to go over by the posts to give Quins a 10-point lead after the break.

But when ex-England winger Nowell and scrum-half Berjon crossed for unconverted tries within four minutes of each other, the sides were level at 17-17 with La Rochelle on course for the knockouts.

However Lawday latched on to a long pass to crash over near the corner, and Smith landed another difficult conversion to make it 24-17.

When the England playmaker kicked a penalty with around a minute remaining, the hopes of Ronan O'Gara's side were in tatters in a major shock in this year's tournament.

La Rochelle: Leyds; Niniashvili, Seuteni, Daunivucu, Bollengier; West, Berjon; Kaddouri, Latu, Atonio (capt), Kante Samba, Boudehent, Jegou, Botia, Cancoriet.

Replacements: Lespiaucq, Wardi, Sclavi, Kuntelia, Alldritt, Fraindt, Favre, Nowell.

Harlequins: T Green; David, Northmore, Bradley, Murley; Smith, Friday; Kerrod, Walker, Delgado, Launchbury, Petti, Cunningham-South, Kenningham, Dombrandt (capt).

Replacements: Riley, Hobson, Williams, Treadwell, Carr, Lawday, M Green, Evans.

Assistant referees: Clara Munarini (Ita), Alberto Favaro (Ita)

title: Roma have 2 fresh injury concerns for Celik and Hermoso
description: Roma have two new injury problems to deal with, as Zeki Celik pulled out in the warm-up of their trip to Torino, then Mario Hermoso limped off.You can follow all the action as it happens from today‚Äô...
fullText:
Roma have two new injury problems to deal with, as Zeki Celik pulled out in the warm-up of their trip to Torino, then Mario Hermoso limped off.

You can follow all the action as it happens from today‚Äôs Serie A games on the Liveblog.

The Giallorossi had initially named Celik in the starting XI on the right flank of a 3-4-2-1 formation, but were forced into a last-minute change.

He felt a twinge in his thigh during the warm-up and was replaced just before kick-off by Devyne Rensch.

GLASGOW, SCOTLAND ‚Äì DECEMBER 11: Zeki Celik of AS Roma is challenged by Kieran Tierney of Celtic during the UEFA Europa League 2025/26 League Phase MD6 match between Celtic FC and AS Roma at Celtic Park on December 11, 2025 in Glasgow, Scotland. (Photo by Ian MacNicol/Getty Images)

The situation for coach Gian Piero Gasperini went from bad to worse, as Hermoso lasted only 22 minutes of the match before limping off the field.

The defender had treatment to his right hip before the medical staff gave the signal for a substitution, so he was replaced by Daniele Ghilardi.

TURIN, ITALY ‚Äì JANUARY 18: Donyell Malen of AS Roma celebrates a goal during the Serie A match between Torino FC and AS Roma at Stadio Olimpico di Torino on January 18, 2026 in Turin, Italy. (Photo by Valerio Pennicino/Getty Images)

Now it remains to be seen how bad these setbacks are, as Roma have a Europa League tie coming up on Thursday with Stuttgart, then next Sunday have a Serie A showdown with second-placed Milan.

There was at least some positive news for Gasperini, as Lorenzo Pellegrini made his comeback after a month out, while Donyell Malen scored on his debut.

title: Browns head coach search: Young candidate gets 2nd interview, joins 2 others
description: The Cleveland Browns head coach search moves on with another 2nd interview, this time young Jaguars OC Grant Udinski
fullText:
The Cleveland Browns head coach search continues on with second interviews getting scheduled, and at least two candidates are now off the list. There was a report Saturday that Green Bay Packers DC Jeff Hafley had interviewed by the Browns and was a ‚Äúlikely finalist‚Äù for multiple jobs, but the team has not confirmed that candidate.

Comment on articles, community posts

New, improved notifications system!

So far, there have been reports that Cleveland DC Jim Schwartz and Baltimore Ravens OC Todd Monken will receive second interviews. The Browns have interviewed a slew of younger candidates for the vacant head coaching position, with Schwartz and Monken by far the most veteran of the interviewees.

On Sunday, news broke that the final and youngest candidate to interview for the position, Jacksonville Jaguars OC Grant Udinski, will also get a second interview:

The Browns will interview Jaguars OC Grant Udinski in-person this week as they move to the second round of interviews, per source. 

The 30-year-old joins Browns DC Jim Schwartz and former Ravens OC Todd Monken, among others, in Round 2. pic.twitter.com/Dhs20dF2sC

‚Äî Tom Pelissero (@TomPelissero) January 18, 2026

If hired, Udinski would be the youngest head coach of all time in the NFL by almost a full year. Los Angeles Rams HC Sean McVay currently holds that mark at 30 years and 353 days. Having just turned 30 years old last week, Udkinski would break that record by over 300 days if hired in this cycle.

You can hear Udinski here talking about his role with the Minnesota Vikings before heading to Jacksonville:

I interviewed #Jaguars OC Grant Udinski before the season about his rise. Here he is discussing everything he learned with the Vikings under Kevin O‚ÄôConnell.

Udinski, just 30 years old, is now a finalist for the #Browns HC job.

(Full interview is here: https://t.co/oobsYh4eg6) pic.twitter.com/8viGIcOdPo

‚Äî Ari Meirov (@MySportsUpdate) January 18, 2026

Besides Udinski, Cincinnati Bengals OC Dan Pitcher, former Miami Dolphins HC Mike McDaniel, and Hafley are the only known candidates who are not still coaching in the playoffs. That could delay Cleveland getting others in for in-person interviews this week.

Do you read into Udinski being added to the second interview list a day after his first interview? If you had to choose between the very veteran options (Schwartz, Monken) or one of the younger guys, like Udinski, do you have a general age/experience-related preference?

Share your head coach search thoughts in the comment section below
